title.function: pack_hep(from, to, proto, payload, plen, retbuf, retlen)

section.para: The function packs connection details and sip message into HEP message. It's your job to free both the old and the new buffer.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: int proto - protocol used in hep header;
int plen SIP payload buffer length

section.para: The function register callbacks to be called whenever a HEP message is received. The callbacks parameters are struct hep_desc*(see hep.h for details) a structure that holds all details about the hep header and the receive_info* structure. The callback can return HEP_SCRIPT_SKIP which stops the HEP message from being passed thrrough scripts.
